intro: Huanaca cavanillesii, commonly known as the Andean moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it conserve moisture in its arid environment. It produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Huanaca cavanillesii is valued both for its ornamental beauty and for its traditional uses in Andean cultures.
